physical_examinations.vital_signs: Temperature: Not specified, Heart Rate: Not specified, Blood Pressure: Not specified, Respiratory Rate: Not specified
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At 3 weeks of age: Serum total calcium 5.2 mg/dl (normal range 9-11 mg/dl), serum phosphate 12.4 mg/dl (normal range 4.5-6.7), serum magnesium 1.2 mg/dl (normal range 1.6-2.3). Serum intact PTH less than 10 pg/ml (normal range 10-72 pg/ml) when serum calcium was 7.4 mg/dl.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Between 12 and 14 months of age, the patient suffered from cramping/tetany every 2-4 weeks, and serum calcium levels ranged between 6.7 and 7.4 mg/dl. After treatment with subcutaneous recombinant human PTH(1-34) at 14 months, serum calcium levels stabilized on a lower calcium dose (130 mg elemental Ca/kg/day), urine Calcium:Creatinine ratio decreased from 2.81 mg/mg to 0.53 mg/mg after 17 months.
